title: Don't log every engine API call
body:
### Description
With besu 22.7.0-RC2, if the CL is syncing, the besu logs just become a torrent of logs about the engine API calls, obscuring all the other information about what besu is actually doing.

```
2022-07-21 05:00:39.203+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-0 | INFO  | EngineNewPayload | New payload: number: 12634841, hash: 0x8082fa9debce4244c0102febb54c2bfb2d66219a70de4d749c5e7138db1384dd, parentHash: 0x6947c681bdc991b4b3ac4042ad05945605ed729fa870af45d46bd2dc1526cfcc, latestValidHash: null, status: SYNCING
2022-07-21 05:00:39.232+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-0 | INFO  | EngineForkchoiceUpdated | SYNCING for fork-choice-update: head: 0x8082fa9debce4244c0102febb54c2bfb2d66219a70de4d749c5e7138db1384dd, finalized: 0x455c9de62588ffffacce8c3110010e1dd5039fee5c64bfaa69c0834c17c1ca94, safeBlockHash: 0xfe6942c1872f3ccdfd32b289fbd11c5d0edf0e49243536da66350ab907962ac7

2022-07-21 05:00:39.851+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-0 | INFO  | EngineNewPayload | New payload: number: 12634857, hash: 0x8cb1405f41ab365e83dd1750549bd7c60ca3823dcaf8bda4df68d1199bcd037f, parentHash: 0x9ef222ff2c15ea57130006abc23269b954ad05329843ca04de1450bda42df5ce, latestValidHash: null, status: SYNCING
2022-07-21 05:00:39.879+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-0 | INFO  | EngineForkchoiceUpdated | SYNCING for fork-choice-update: head: 0x8cb1405f41ab365e83dd1750549bd7c60ca3823dcaf8bda4df68d1199bcd037f, finalized: 0x455c9de62588ffffacce8c3110010e
1dd5039fee5c64bfaa69c0834c17c1ca94, safeBlockHash: 0xfe6942c1872f3ccdfd32b289fbd11c5d0edf0e49243536da66350ab907962ac7
```

Taking the first two newPayload calls from the log as example: 
```
2022-07-21 05:00:39.203+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-0 | INFO  | EngineNewPayload | New payload: number: 12634841, hash: 0x8082fa9debce4244c0102febb54c2bfb2d66219a70de4d749c5e7138db1384dd, parentHash: 0x6947c681bdc991b4b3ac4042ad05945605ed729fa870af45d46bd2dc1526cfcc, latestValidHash: null, status: SYNCING
2022-07-21 05:00:39.279+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-0 | INFO  | EngineNewPayload | New payload: number: 12634842, hash: 0xaeafd8e8e4afb73fd34047bab6334d51bbdbc993dbc9650cae0322a4538541de, parentHash: 0x8082fa9debce4244c0102febb54c2bfb2d66219a70de4d749c5e7138db1384dd, latestValidHash: null, status: SYNCING
```

There are only 76ms between those two calls. Why is the CL calling that often? 

My point is, it's hard to decide which calls are important and which aren't. If we don't log everything, we could lose valuable information.

The CL is syncing so its importing blocks as fast as it can and needs to send updates to the EL.

The user doesn't care about any of these calls - there's no action they can take from any of them and they should just be at debug level. It's the same as we don't log every P2P message with peers.
I agree with Adrian here - can move to Debug and have Info provide maybe a (less) recurring log until CL sync complete?

There needs to be some happy medium.  If we do not log fcU during sync or backward sync there is complete radio silence.  Rather than just moving them to debug perhaps we need to have a periodic timer that logs current fcU parameters and dial the rest down to debug

A periodic update on the sync progress makes sense, I don't think it's really tied to the engine calls being made because the engine calls don't mean anything to users.

A regular log line something like: `Syncing - Blocks: 1,000,000/10,000,000 (10%), World state: 25%, Peer count: 25` is the kind of thing I'd love to see.  They may not be the exact details and there would need to be variants when progress is paused waiting for peers or waiting for info from the CL etc but the idea being it's a deliberate progress update log, not just a record of the mechanics of how sync works.

I am biased, but I find logging the details of fcU quite useful when the CL is not syncing.  Similar to the way besu logs block imports when using PoW / block gossip, it 'feels' like a heartbeat.  Of course when the CL is syncing it is just an avalanche of noise.  

The difference in log behavior when our response is  `syncing` makes sense.  I think we can just remove the logging in those cases and instead rely on whatever sync method is happening to log progress.  Also turning down getPayload and newPayload logging to debug would be appropriate.

> I am biased, but I find logging the details of fcU quite useful when the CL is not syncing. Similar to the way besu logs block imports when using PoW / block gossip, it 'feels' like a heartbeat. Of course when the CL is syncing it is just an avalanche of noise.

I think it's useful for besu to report the blocks it imports as part of tracking head which should give the same heart beat when things are in sync.  Those happen to be triggered by a newPayload call or maybe the fCU setting a new head, but it's not about reporting the call it's about reporting on the new block.  Or in other words, it's focussed on what the user cares about, not the mechanics of how things happen to be working.

It's also worth noting that besu may be in sync while the CL is syncing (because the CL's database was deleted and its resending). Or the EL and CL could be doing a long lock step sync, both importing blocks as fast as possible with besu returning VALID for each block - for example when the node is in sync but then the box goes to sleep for a couple of days and then wakes up and resumes from where it was up to.
